<h1 class="firstHeading no_toc"><a href="https://www.wikihow.com/Lessen-a-Double-Chin">How to Lessen a Double Chin</a></h1>
<div class="ss_check" id="expert_coauthor">

<p>Double chins are often a natural result of aging or gaining a little weight. If you'd like to slim down your chin area, there are several approaches you can take. Getting the right haircut, doing chin exercises, and having good posture are easy changes you can make right away.</p>

<h2 class="hidden"><span class="mw-headline" id="Steps">Steps</span></h2>
<a class="anchor" name="Making_Your_Chin_Look_Smaller_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky steps_first">
<h3>
<div class="altblock">Part <span>1</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Making_Your_Chin_Look_Smaller">Making Your Chin Look Smaller</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_1">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-1-Version-9.jpg?ajax=true&aid=60533" href="#/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-1-Version-9.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ac/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-1-Version-9.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-1-Version-9.jpg" height="546" id="img_6e096ebd26" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_6e096ebd26')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ac/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-1-Version-9.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-1-Version-9.jpg" width="728"/></noscript>
<script>WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');</script></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Use makeup to strategically cover it up.</b> Try to make your jawline feature more prominently than your neck by using a powder that is a shade darker than your skin tone. The powder should be blended in from ear to ear and into the neck area. Draw attention away from the neck area with colorful blush and interesting eye makeup.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 1" class="reference" id="_ref-1"><a href="#_note-1">[1]</a></sup> If you can't get it right yourself, see a makeup artist to show you how to do this.

<ul>
<li>Wearing eyeliner and mascara makes the eyes look larger and draws attention away from the chin.</li>
<li>Minimize attention to your lower face by wearing neutral lipstick shades.</li>
</ul>
<script>WH.performance.mark('step1_rendered');</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-2-Version-9.jpg?ajax=true&aid=60533" href="#/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-2-Version-9.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7a/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-2-Version-9.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-2-Version-9.jpg" height="546" id="img_733fa03e86" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_733fa03e86')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7a/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-2-Version-9.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-2-Version-9.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Change your hairstyle.</b> Don't have a haircut that rests right at the level of your chin, or very long hair, because both styles will draw more attention to your chin. A medium cut just below the chin is your best bet.
Here are a few options:

<ul>
<li>Go for a long bob. This classic cut looks great on people with larger chins. It should stop an inch or two below your chin line.</li>
<li>Get an angled haircut. Have the longer hair in front, shorter hair in the back. The longer hair in front reduces the size of and draws less attention to the chin.</li>
<li>Try layered waves. A full hairstyle balances the face and draws attention away from the chin.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-3-Version-9.jpg?ajax=true&aid=60533" href="#/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-3-Version-9.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/63/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-3-Version-9.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-3-Version-9.jpg" height="546" id="img_d947610b7b" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_d947610b7b')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/63/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-3-Version-9.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-3-Version-9.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Grow a beard.</b> If you're a guy, having the right facial hair can go a long way toward making your chin look smaller. Grow out your beard all the way to your neck. Keep it groomed neatly, but allow it to be thick. This will even things out in your chin and neck area.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-4-Version-9.jpg?ajax=true&aid=60533" href="#/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-4-Version-9.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/91/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-4-Version-9.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-4-Version-9.jpg" height="546" id="img_9c7f48f8cd" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_9c7f48f8cd')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/91/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-4-Version-9.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-4-Version-9.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Don't wear choker necklaces.</b> They are tight on the neck, emphasizing the double chin and possibly leaving red marks. If you still want this look, there are necklaces that have a similar design to dog collars, but hang like regular necklaces.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-5-Version-9.jpg?ajax=true&aid=60533" href="#/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-5-Version-9.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b4/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-5-Version-9.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-5-Version-9.jpg" height="546" id="img_3e365fde4c" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_3e365fde4c')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b4/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-5-Version-9.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-5-Version-9.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Consider your clothes.</b> Are the clothes you're wearing making your chin look larger? Wear a broad, open neckline to draw attention away from the chin. Avoid high-necked shirts and blouses, including turtlenecks and tops with fancy detailing.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 2" class="reference" id="_ref-2"><a href="#_note-2">[2]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-6-Version-9.jpg?ajax=true&aid=60533" href="#/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-6-Version-9.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/83/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-6-Version-9.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-6-Version-9.jpg" height="546" id="img_98db861045" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_98db861045')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/83/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-6-Version-9.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-6-Version-9.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Check your <a href="/Improve-Your-Posture" title="Improve Your Posture">posture</a>.</b> How do you stand? If you are slumping, you will be creating unnecessary lumps and bumps on your body, including around your chin area because the fat seeks infirm areas to settle in. Stand up tall, put your head up, shoulders back and uncurve that spine. See a professional physiotherapist who can recommend simple but effective exercises to improve your posture. Keep active.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-apsload="1" data-channels="8161489800,4805470868" data-lateload="0" data-loaded="1" data-service="adsense" data-slot="7750426266" data-viewablerefresh="1">
<ins class="adsbygoogle" data-ad-client="ca-pub-9543332082073187" data-ad-slot="7750426266" style="display:inline-block;width:728px;height:90px;"></ins><script>(adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({params: {google_ad_channel: '8161489800,4805470868'}});</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Exercising_Your_Chin_Area_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock">Part <span>2</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Exercising_Your_Chin_Area">Exercising Your Chin Area</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_2">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-7-Version-9.jpg?ajax=true&aid=60533" href="#/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-7-Version-9.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/17/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-7-Version-9.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-7-Version-9.jpg" height="546" id="img_4cef5b5447" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_4cef5b5447')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/17/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-7-Version-9.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-7-Version-9.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Do chin lifts.</b> This exercise helps to strengthen and tighten the muscles in your face and neck. To do it, stand with your back and neck straight. Raise your chin toward the ceiling and look at the ceiling. Pucker your lips toward the ceiling and hold for a count of 10 seconds. Repeat 10 times. Do the exercise every day for best effect.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 3" class="reference" id="_ref-3"><a href="#_note-3">[3]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-8-Version-9.jpg?ajax=true&aid=60533" href="#/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-8-Version-9.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4c/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-8-Version-9.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-8-Version-9.jpg" height="546" id="img_348fb030db" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_348fb030db')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4c/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-8-Version-9.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-8-Version-9.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Roll your neck.</b> Stand with your spine upright. Turn your head to the side so that your chin is parallel to your shoulder. Your eyes should be looking off to the side, too. Slowly roll your head downward, then up to the other side. Repeat 10 times.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 4" class="reference" id="_ref-4"><a href="#_note-4">[4]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-9-Version-9.jpg?ajax=true&aid=60533" href="#/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-9-Version-9.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a8/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-9-Version-9.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-9-Version-9.jpg" height="546" id="img_68d53d5027" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_68d53d5027')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a8/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-9-Version-9.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-9-Version-9.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Exercise your platysma.</b> This is the muscle that runs down your neck from your jaw. Stand with your neck erect. Tighten the tendons in your jaw by pulling your lips up over your teeth and turning the corners of your mouth downward, almost as if you were frowning. Hold for 10 seconds, then relax. Repeat the exercise ten times.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 5" class="reference" id="_ref-5"><a href="#_note-5">[5]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-10-Version-9.jpg?ajax=true&aid=60533" href="#/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-10-Version-9.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/62/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-10-Version-9.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-10-Version-9.jpg" height="546" id="img_913790e2fc" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_913790e2fc')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/62/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-10-Version-9.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-10-Version-9.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Use a tennis ball.</b> Place it against your neck and hold it there with your chin. Press your chin against the ball tightly, then slightly release. Repeat ten times.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 6" class="reference" id="_ref-6"><a href="#_note-6">[6]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-11-Version-8.jpg?ajax=true&aid=60533" href="#/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-11-Version-8.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/41/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-11-Version-8.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-11-Version-8.jpg" height="546" id="img_f3f2ee33c8" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_f3f2ee33c8')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/41/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-11-Version-8.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-11-Version-8.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Chew gum.</b> This is an easy exercise to do, since it hardly requires any thought. Chewing gum keeps your jaw muscles strong, helping to reduce a double chin.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 7" class="reference" id="_ref-7"><a href="#_note-7">[7]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-apsload="1" data-channels="8161489800,4805470868" data-lateload="0" data-loaded="1" data-service="adsense" data-slot="7750426266" data-viewablerefresh="1">
<ins class="adsbygoogle" data-ad-client="ca-pub-9543332082073187" data-ad-slot="7750426266" style="display:inline-block;width:728px;height:90px;"></ins><script>(adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({params: {google_ad_channel: '8161489800,4805470868'}});</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Losing_Weight_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock">Part <span>3</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Losing_Weight">Losing Weight</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_3">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-12-Version-9.jpg?ajax=true&aid=60533" href="#/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-12-Version-9.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e2/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-12-Version-9.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-12-Version-9.jpg" height="546" id="img_4056124cb1" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_4056124cb1')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e2/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-12-Version-9.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-12-Version-9.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Do general exercise.</b> Exercising your whole body to lose weight will eventually reduce fat in the facial area, too. In fact, it's very difficult to lose weight in just your face, and that's often the last place to thin out. Starting a steady exercise routine with cardio and strength training can put you on the path toward a thinner face.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 8" class="reference" id="_ref-8"><a href="#_note-8">[8]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Running, swimming, and biking are all great cardio activities. Plan to do one of these activities for at least 1/2 hour 4 times a week.</li>
<li>Go to the gym and meet with a personal trainer to get acquainted with a strength training routine. Learn how to lift weights to work out all of your muscle groups.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-13-Version-9.jpg?ajax=true&aid=60533" href="#/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-13-Version-9.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/64/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-13-Version-9.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-13-Version-9.jpg" height="546" id="img_0fcce19caa" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_0fcce19caa')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/64/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-13-Version-9.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-13-Version-9.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Limit your calorie intake.</b> This reduces the amount of fat you store in your body and your face. Satisfy your hunger with fruits, salad and low calorie food items. If you are really serious about getting rid of your double chin, losing weight can definitely help.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 9" class="reference" id="_ref-9"><a href="#_note-9">[9]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Don't try anything restrictive or faddish. Your change must be one that you can carry on for the rest of your life. Small, consistent losses are what you should be aiming for and maintaining.</li>
<li>Your diet should include plenty of fiber, fruits, vegetables and water. See a nutritionist, dietician or doctor for advice and encouragement.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Going_Deeper_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock">Part <span>4</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Going_Deeper">Going Deeper</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_4">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-14-Version-9.jpg?ajax=true&aid=60533" href="#/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-14-Version-9.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/db/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-14-Version-9.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-14-Version-9.jpg" height="546" id="img_4d3c0ffa26" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_4d3c0ffa26')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/db/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-14-Version-9.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-14-Version-9.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">See your doctor.</b> If there is a fluid problem around your chin area, it may need further consideration. If there is simply fluid retention, ask your doctor to refer you to a masso-therapist who can expertly massage the area to try to unblock the fluid and assist with better posture and relaxation.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage final_li">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-15-Version-6.jpg?ajax=true&aid=60533" href="#/Image:Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-15-Version-6.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 15" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9d/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-15-Version-6.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-15-Version-6.jpg" height="546" id="img_3abe06f927" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_3abe06f927')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Lessen a Double Chin Step 15" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9d/Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-15-Version-6.jpg/aid60533-v4-728px-Lessen-a-Double-Chin-Step-15-Version-6.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Appreciate yourself for who you are.</b> Your appearance is more than your genetic features. How you dress, how you present yourself, how you communicate with others, how you share your sense of you with others and how much confidence you have in yourself as a worthy human being are all worth 1000 times more than the appearance of a double chin.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="244891" data-caid="245764" data-cqid="244908" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="1568853" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="1" data-votes_up="21">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">I am overweight, if I reduce my weight would my double chin go? I'm only 16.</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">If you have a double chin due to your weight, it will go away if you lose the weight. However, if you have a double chin due to genetics, then losing weight may only reduce the look of the double chin. </div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">

<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>1</span></a>

</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="369487" data-caid="370360" data-cqid="369504" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="2083882" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="2" data-votes_up="25">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>

<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">No. When the body is hungry, this sends a signal to store food reserves as fat. You'll do far better to lost fat by eating small, nutritious meals than starving yourself.  </div>

</div>

</div>

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="19945" data-caid="20818" data-cqid="19962" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="182918" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="43" data-votes_up="175">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>

<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">It might not, since sometimes double chins are caused by genetics. However, if you are overweight, losing weight will definitely help and it might even totally remove it.</div>

<div class="section tips sticky">
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Tips">Tips</span></h2>
<div class="section_text" id="tips">
<ul>
<li>Don't spend too many hours slumped over a computer everyday. If you must work with a computer all day, do stretches every half an hour.</li>
<li>If you have a genetic tendency towards a double chin (i.e. look at your parents, other family members), then you have even more reason to exercise and eat healthily to avoid getting a double chin or to reduce one you may already have.</li>
<li>Puffy scarves can cover up a double chin. However, avoid turtle necks or high-necked clothing as these emphasize the chin area.</li>
<li>Moisturize your neck area and chin before doing neck exercise to avoid and prevent wrinkles.</li>
<li>We live in an age of the "youth culture" and sadly we've forgotten how to age gracefully through acceptance of the reality of human anatomy. There is freedom and wisdom in growing older; gains that looking young will never outdo.</li>
<li>If you have a fat chin then wear a striking hat, a bright colored shirt or patterned pants/skirt. This will draw attention away from your face.</li>
</ul>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="section warnings sticky">
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Warnings">Warnings</span></h2>
<div class="section_text" id="warnings">
<ul>
<li>Don't tan too much, or at the very least, cover up your neck and face region; the sun helps to break down the skin's elasticity earlier than the normal course of aging.</li>
</ul>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>

<h2>Article Summary<a href="#" id="summary_close">X</a>
</h2>
<p>To lessen a double chin, you'll need to lose weight overall since you can't target which parts of your body you want to lose fat in. Fortunately, you can start losing weight and thinning out your face by getting in 30 minutes of cardio exercise, like biking or running, 4 times a week. Also, try to eat healthy foods like fruits and vegetables to help you with your weight loss. In the meantime, you can do things that will tone your chin, like chewing gum regularly and doing chin lifts. <span id="summary_last_sentence">To learn how to make your double chin look smaller with makeup, clothes, or your hairstyle, keep reading!</span><span class="sumpos_bottom" id="summary_position"></span></p>

        "sameAs": [
            "https:\/\/www.facebook.com\/wikiHow\/",
            "https:\/\/twitter.com\/wikiHow",
            "https:\/\/www.instagram.com\/wikihow\/",

    "step": [
        {
            "@type": "HowToSection",
            "name": "Making Your Chin Look Smaller",
            "position": 1,
            "itemListElement": [
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 1,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Use makeup to strategically cover it up. Try to make your jawline feature more prominently than your neck by using a powder that is a shade darker than your skin tone. The powder should be blended in from ear to ear and into the neck area. Draw attention away from the neck area with colorful blush and interesting eye makeup.[1] If you can't get it right yourself, see a makeup artist to show you how to do this.\n\nWearing eyeliner and mascara makes the eyes look larger and draws attention away from the chin.\nMinimize attention to your lower face by wearing neutral lipstick shades."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 2,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Change your hairstyle. Don't have a haircut that rests right at the level of your chin, or very long hair, because both styles will draw more attention to your chin. A medium cut just below the chin is your best bet.\nHere are a few options:\n\nGo for a long bob. This classic cut looks great on people with larger chins. It should stop an inch or two below your chin line.\nGet an angled haircut. Have the longer hair in front, shorter hair in the back. The longer hair in front reduces the size of and draws less attention to the chin.\nTry layered waves. A full hairstyle balances the face and draws attention away from the chin."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 3,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Grow a beard. If you're a guy, having the right facial hair can go a long way toward making your chin look smaller. Grow out your beard all the way to your neck. Keep it groomed neatly, but allow it to be thick. This will even things out in your chin and neck area."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 4,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Don't wear choker necklaces. They are tight on the neck, emphasizing the double chin and possibly leaving red marks. If you still want this look, there are necklaces that have a similar design to dog collars, but hang like regular necklaces."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 5,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Consider your clothes. Are the clothes you're wearing making your chin look larger? Wear a broad, open neckline to draw attention away from the chin. Avoid high-necked shirts and blouses, including turtlenecks and tops with fancy detailing.[2]"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 6,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Check your posture. How do you stand? If you are slumping, you will be creating unnecessary lumps and bumps on your body, including around your chin area because the fat seeks infirm areas to settle in. Stand up tall, put your head up, shoulders back and uncurve that spine. See a professional physiotherapist who can recommend simple but effective exercises to improve your posture. Keep active."
                    }
                }
            ]
        },
        {
            "@type": "HowToSection",
            "name": "Exercising Your Chin Area",
            "position": 2,
            "itemListElement": [
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 1,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Do chin lifts. This exercise helps to strengthen and tighten the muscles in your face and neck. To do it, stand with your back and neck straight. Raise your chin toward the ceiling and look at the ceiling. Pucker your lips toward the ceiling and hold for a count of 10 seconds. Repeat 10 times. Do the exercise every day for best effect.[3]"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 2,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Roll your neck. Stand with your spine upright. Turn your head to the side so that your chin is parallel to your shoulder. Your eyes should be looking off to the side, too. Slowly roll your head downward, then up to the other side. Repeat 10 times.[4]"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 3,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Exercise your platysma. This is the muscle that runs down your neck from your jaw. Stand with your neck erect. Tighten the tendons in your jaw by pulling your lips up over your teeth and turning the corners of your mouth downward, almost as if you were frowning. Hold for 10 seconds, then relax. Repeat the exercise ten times.[5]"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 4,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Use a tennis ball. Place it against your neck and hold it there with your chin. Press your chin against the ball tightly, then slightly release. Repeat ten times.[6]"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 5,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Chew gum. This is an easy exercise to do, since it hardly requires any thought. Chewing gum keeps your jaw muscles strong, helping to reduce a double chin.[7]"
                    }
                }
            ]
        },
        {
            "@type": "HowToSection",
            "name": "Losing Weight",
            "position": 3,
            "itemListElement": [
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 1,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Do general exercise. Exercising your whole body to lose weight will eventually reduce fat in the facial area, too. In fact, it's very difficult to lose weight in just your face, and that's often the last place to thin out. Starting a steady exercise routine with cardio and strength training can put you on the path toward a thinner face.[8]\nRunning, swimming, and biking are all great cardio activities. Plan to do one of these activities for at least 1\/2 hour 4 times a week.\nGo to the gym and meet with a personal trainer to get acquainted with a strength training routine. Learn how to lift weights to work out all of your muscle groups."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 2,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Limit your calorie intake. This reduces the amount of fat you store in your body and your face. Satisfy your hunger with fruits, salad and low calorie food items. If you are really serious about getting rid of your double chin, losing weight can definitely help.[9]\nDon't try anything restrictive or faddish. Your change must be one that you can carry on for the rest of your life. Small, consistent losses are what you should be aiming for and maintaining.\nYour diet should include plenty of fiber, fruits, vegetables and water. See a nutritionist, dietician or doctor for advice and encouragement."
                    }
                }
            ]
        },
        {
            "@type": "HowToSection",
            "name": "Going Deeper",
            "position": 4,
            "itemListElement": [
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 1,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "See your doctor. If there is a fluid problem around your chin area, it may need further consideration. If there is simply fluid retention, ask your doctor to refer you to a masso-therapist who can expertly massage the area to try to unblock the fluid and assist with better posture and relaxation."
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 2,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Appreciate yourself for who you are. Your appearance is more than your genetic features. How you dress, how you present yourself, how you communicate with others, how you share your sense of you with others and how much confidence you have in yourself as a worthy human being are all worth 1000 times more than the appearance of a double chin."
                    }
                }
            ]
        }
    ],
    "description": "How to Lessen a Double Chin. Double chins are often a natural result of aging or gaining a little weight. If you'd like to slim down your chin area, there are several approaches you can take. Getting the right haircut, doing chin..."

content_html:
Use makeup to strategically cover it up. Try to make your jawline feature more prominently than your neck by using a powder that is a shade darker than your skin tone. The powder should be blended in from ear to ear and into the neck area. Draw attention away from the neck area with colorful blush and interesting eye makeup.[1] If you can't get it right yourself, see a makeup artist to show you how to do this.
  • Wearing eyeliner and mascara makes the eyes look larger and draws attention away from the chin.
  • Minimize attention to your lower face by wearing neutral lipstick shades.
Change your hairstyle. Don't have a haircut that rests right at the level of your chin, or very long hair, because both styles will draw more attention to your chin. A medium cut just below the chin is your best bet. Here are a few options:
  • Go for a long bob. This classic cut looks great on people with larger chins. It should stop an inch or two below your chin line.
  • Get an angled haircut. Have the longer hair in front, shorter hair in the back. The longer hair in front reduces the size of and draws less attention to the chin.
  • Try layered waves. A full hairstyle balances the face and draws attention away from the chin.
Grow a beard. If you're a guy, having the right facial hair can go a long way toward making your chin look smaller. Grow out your beard all the way to your neck. Keep it groomed neatly, but allow it to be thick. This will even things out in your chin and neck area.
Don't wear choker necklaces. They are tight on the neck, emphasizing the double chin and possibly leaving red marks. If you still want this look, there are necklaces that have a similar design to dog collars, but hang like regular necklaces.
Consider your clothes. Are the clothes you're wearing making your chin look larger? Wear a broad, open neckline to draw attention away from the chin. Avoid high-necked shirts and blouses, including turtlenecks and tops with fancy detailing.[2]
Check your posture. How do you stand? If you are slumping, you will be creating unnecessary lumps and bumps on your body, including around your chin area because the fat seeks infirm areas to settle in. Stand up tall, put your head up, shoulders back and uncurve that spine. See a professional physiotherapist who can recommend simple but effective exercises to improve your posture. Keep active.
Do chin lifts. This exercise helps to strengthen and tighten the muscles in your face and neck. To do it, stand with your back and neck straight. Raise your chin toward the ceiling and look at the ceiling. Pucker your lips toward the ceiling and hold for a count of 10 seconds. Repeat 10 times. Do the exercise every day for best effect.[3]
Roll your neck. Stand with your spine upright. Turn your head to the side so that your chin is parallel to your shoulder. Your eyes should be looking off to the side, too. Slowly roll your head downward, then up to the other side. Repeat 10 times.[4]
Exercise your platysma. This is the muscle that runs down your neck from your jaw. Stand with your neck erect. Tighten the tendons in your jaw by pulling your lips up over your teeth and turning the corners of your mouth downward, almost as if you were frowning. Hold for 10 seconds, then relax. Repeat the exercise ten times.[5]
Use a tennis ball. Place it against your neck and hold it there with your chin. Press your chin against the ball tightly, then slightly release. Repeat ten times.[6]
Chew gum. This is an easy exercise to do, since it hardly requires any thought. Chewing gum keeps your jaw muscles strong, helping to reduce a double chin.[7]
Do general exercise. Exercising your whole body to lose weight will eventually reduce fat in the facial area, too. In fact, it's very difficult to lose weight in just your face, and that's often the last place to thin out. Starting a steady exercise routine with cardio and strength training can put you on the path toward a thinner face.[8]
  • Running, swimming, and biking are all great cardio activities. Plan to do one of these activities for at least 1/2 hour 4 times a week.
  • Go to the gym and meet with a personal trainer to get acquainted with a strength training routine. Learn how to lift weights to work out all of your muscle groups.
Limit your calorie intake. This reduces the amount of fat you store in your body and your face. Satisfy your hunger with fruits, salad and low calorie food items. If you are really serious about getting rid of your double chin, losing weight can definitely help.[9]
  • Don't try anything restrictive or faddish. Your change must be one that you can carry on for the rest of your life. Small, consistent losses are what you should be aiming for and maintaining.
  • Your diet should include plenty of fiber, fruits, vegetables and water. See a nutritionist, dietician or doctor for advice and encouragement.
See your doctor. If there is a fluid problem around your chin area, it may need further consideration. If there is simply fluid retention, ask your doctor to refer you to a masso-therapist who can expertly massage the area to try to unblock the fluid and assist with better posture and relaxation.
Appreciate yourself for who you are. Your appearance is more than your genetic features. How you dress, how you present yourself, how you communicate with others, how you share your sense of you with others and how much confidence you have in yourself as a worthy human being are all worth 1000 times more than the appearance of a double chin.
content: Use makeup to strategically cover it up. Try to make your jawline feature more prominently than your neck by using a powder that is a shade darker than your skin tone. The powder should be blended in from ear to ear and into the neck area. Draw attention away from the neck area with colorful blush and interesting eye makeup. [1] If you can't get it right yourself, see a makeup artist to show you how to do this. Wearing eyeliner and mascara makes the eyes look larger and draws attention away from the chin. Minimize attention to your lower face by wearing neutral lipstick shades. Change your hairstyle. Don't have a haircut that rests right at the level of your chin, or very long hair, because both styles will draw more attention to your chin. A medium cut just below the chin is your best bet. Here are a few options: Go for a long bob. This classic cut looks great on people with larger chins. It should stop an inch or two below your chin line. Get an angled haircut. Have the longer hair in front, shorter hair in the back. The longer hair in front reduces the size of and draws less attention to the chin. Try layered waves. A full hairstyle balances the face and draws attention away from the chin. Grow a beard. If you're a guy, having the right facial hair can go a long way toward making your chin look smaller. Grow out your beard all the way to your neck. Keep it groomed neatly, but allow it to be thick. This will even things out in your chin and neck area. Don't wear choker necklaces. They are tight on the neck, emphasizing the double chin and possibly leaving red marks. If you still want this look, there are necklaces that have a similar design to dog collars, but hang like regular necklaces. Consider your clothes. Are the clothes you're wearing making your chin look larger? Wear a broad, open neckline to draw attention away from the chin.
